etymology.description: 日 (day) + 报/報 (report; newspaper) = a report or publication issued daily.
etymology.interpretation: Indicates something reported or published every day; in media it means a daily newspaper, in workplaces it can mean a daily report.
etymology.simplification: 報 was simplified to 报 to reduce strokes by streamlining components; 日 remained unchanged.

examples.chinese: 我每天读日报(我每天讀日報)。
examples.english: I read the daily newspaper every day.

examples.chinese: 公司要求大家每天提交日报(公司要求大家每天提交日報)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngsī yāoqiú dàjiā měitiān tíjiāo rìbào.
examples.english: The company requires everyone to submit a daily report each day.

examples.chinese: 这家日报创刊于1949年(這家日報創刊於1949年)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā rìbào chuàngkān yú yī jiǔ sì jiǔ nián.
examples.english: This daily newspaper was first published in 1949.
